sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of entertainment outcome occurring in a performance.
message_1: In a magic show, a magician performs three tricks. The probability of trick 1 being successful is 0.8, the probability of trick 2 being successful is 0.7 and the probability of trick 3 being successful is 0.9. What is the probability that all three tricks will be successful?
message_2:
To find the probability that all three tricks will be successful, we need to multiply the probabilities of each trick being successful together.

Probability of all three tricks being successful = (Probability of Trick 1 being successful) × (Probability of Trick 2 being successful) × (Probability of Trick 3 being successful)

= 0.8 × 0.7 × 0.9
= 0.504

So, the probability that all three tricks will be successful is 0.504 or 50.4%.
